sen.j: 日宋貿易（にっそうぼうえき）とは、日本と中国の宋 (王朝)朝（南宋）の間で行われた貿易である。
sen.e: Nisso boeki was the trade done between Japan and the Sung Dynasty (Southern Sung Dynasty) in China.
Nisso boeki was the trade done between Japan and the Sung Dynasty (Southern Sung Dynasty) in China.
Nisso boeki was the trade done between Japan and the Sung Dynasty (Southern Sung Dynasty) in China.

sen.j: 10世紀から13世紀にかけて行われ、日本の時代区分では平安時代の中期から鎌倉時代の中期にあたる。
sen.e: The trade was done from 10th through 13th century, which is equivalent to mid Heian through mid Kamakura period in the periodization of Japan.
The trade was done from the 10th through 13th century, which is equivalent to mid Heian through mid Kamakura period in Japan.
The trade was done from the 10th through 13th century, which is equivalent to mid Heian through mid Kamakura period in Japan.

sen.j: 中国の唐朝に対して日本が派遣した遣唐使が停止されて以来の日中交渉。
sen.e: It was the first diplomacy between Japan and China since sending Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) that Japan dispatched had been stopped.
It was the first diplomacy between Japan and China since sending Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) from Japan had been stopped.
It was the first diplomacy between Japan and China since sending Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) from Japan had been stopped.

sen.j: 貿易は朝鮮半島の高麗を含めた三国間で行われた。
sen.e: The trade was done among the three countries including Goryeo in Korean Peninsular.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The trade was done among the three countries including Goryeo in the Korean Peninsula.
The trade was done among the three countries including Goryeo in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 日本では越前国敦賀や、鎌倉時代には多くの宋人が住み国際都市となった博多が拠点となる。
sen.e: In Japan Tsuruga, Echizen Province and Hakata that many Chinese lived in in Kamakura Period and became an international city were the bases for the trade.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan Tsuruga, Echizen Province, and Hakata where many Chinese lived in the Kamakura Period became international cities and were the bases for the trade.
In Japan Tsuruga, Echizen Province, and Hakata where many Chinese lived in the Kamakura Period became international cities and were the bases for the trade.

sen.j: 960年（天徳 (日本)4年）に成立した宋（960‐1279）は貿易を振興する目的で各地に市舶司を設置し、日本、朝鮮との貿易や南海貿易を行った。
sen.e: The Sung Dynasty (960-1279) which was established in 960 placed shihakushi (the public office that operated on trade on the sea in China from Tang-Dynasty period to Ming Dynasty period) in various places, and traded with Japan and Korea, and it also did the trade between China and countries in the southern area.

The Sung Dynasty (960-1279) which was established in 960 placed shihakushi (the public office that operated on trade on the sea in China from Tang-Dynasty period to Ming Dynasty period) in various places, and traded with Japan and Korea, and it also did the trade between China and countries in the southern area.

The Sung Dynasty (960-1279) which was established in 960 placed shihakushi (the public office that operated on trade on the sea in China from Tang-Dynasty period to Ming Dynasty period) in various places, and traded with Japan and Korea, and it also did the trade between China and countries in the southern area.

sen.j: 日本では大宰府の監督のもとで鴻臚館貿易が行われていた。
sen.e: In Japan Korokan trade was being done under the supervision of Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan Korokan trade was being done under the supervision of Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).

In Japan, trade via the Korokan (International Reception Hall in the then capital, Heian-kyo [present day Kyoto]) was being conducted under the supervision of the Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).

sen.j: だが、大宰府は平安時代になると機能が消失したわけではないものの衰微する。
sen.e: However, although the function of Dazaifu did not disappear, the trade decreased drastically.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, although the function of Dazaifu did not disappear, the trade decreased drastically.
However, although the function of Dazaifu did not disappear, the trade decreased drastically.

sen.j: 日中間の正式の外交貿易は行われず、一般人の渡航は禁止された。
sen.e: The official trade between Japan and China stopped, and ordinary people's overseas travel was prohibited.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The official trade between Japan and China stopped, and ordinary people's overseas travel was prohibited.
The official trade between Japan and China stopped, and ordinary people's overseas travel was prohibited.

sen.j: 宋の商人は主に博多や越前敦賀へ来航し、私貿易が行われていた。
sen.e: The merchants in Sung mainly came to Hakata and Tsuruga, Echizen Province to do private trade with Japanese.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The merchants in Sung mainly came to Hakata and Tsuruga, Echizen Province, to do private trade with Japanese.
The merchants in Sung mainly came to Hakata and Tsuruga, Echizen Province, to do private trade with Japanese.

sen.j: 越前守でもあった平忠盛は日宋貿易に着目し、後院領である肥前国神崎荘を知行して独自に交易を行った。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tadamori, who was also Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), aiming at the trade between Japan and China, governed Kanzaki no sho (imperial estate) in Hizen Province which was goinryo (lands attached to the place of a retired emperor), and did his own trade.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: TAIRA no Tadamori, who was also Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), aiming at the trade between Japan and China, governed Kanzaki no sho (imperial estate) in Hizen Province which was goinryo (lands attached to the place of a retired emperor), and did his own trade.

TAIRA no Tadamori, who was also Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), aiming at the trade between Japan and China, governed Kanzaki no sho (imperial estate) in Hizen Province which was goinryo (lands attached to the place of a retired emperor), and did his own trade.

sen.j: 舶来品を院に進呈して近臣として認められるようになった。
sen.e: He presented imported articles to the retired emperor and came to be recognized as a trusted vassal.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He presented imported articles to the retired emperor and came to be recognized as a trusted vassal.
He presented imported articles to the retired emperor and came to be recognized as a trusted vassal.

sen.j: 平氏政権が成立し、平氏は勢力基盤であった伊勢国の産出する銀などを輸出品に貿易を行った。
sen.e: With the establishment of Taira clan government, Taira clan did trade with silver produced in Ise Province, which was the basis of the force of the clan, as an export item.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the establishment of Taira clan government, Taira clan did trade with silver produced in Ise Province, which was the basis of the force of the clan, as an export item.
With the establishment of Taira clan government, the Taira clan did trade with silver produced in Ise Province, which was the basis of the force of the clan, as an export item.
sen.cmt: 二度目の Taira clan を the Taira clan としました。

sen.j: 平清盛は平治の乱の直前の1158年に大宰大弐となった。
sen.e: TAIRA no Kiyomori became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) in 1158 just before the Heiji War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: TAIRA no Kiyomori became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) in 1158 just before the Heiji War.
TAIRA no Kiyomori became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) in 1158 just before the Heiji War.

sen.j: 日本で最初の人工港を博多に築き貿易を本格化させた。
sen.e: He built the artificial harbor in Hakata for the first time in Japanese history and began trade in earnest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He built the artificial harbor in Hakata for the first time in Japanese history and began trade in earnest.
He built the artificial harbor in Hakata for the first time in Japanese history and began trade in earnest.

sen.j: 寺社勢力を排除して瀬戸内海航路を掌握。
sen.e: He eliminated the power of temples and shrines and managed to take control of sea routes in Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He eliminated the power of temples and shrines and managed to take control of sea routes in Seto Inland Sea.
He eliminated the power of temples and shrines and managed to take control of sea routes in Seto Inland Sea.

sen.j: 航路の整備や入港管理を行い、宋船による厳島参詣を行う。
sen.e: He maintained the sea routes and administered the port entry and did the Pilgrimage to Itsukushima by Sung-era ship.
He maintained the sea routes and administered the port entry and did the Pilgrimage to Itsukushima by Sung-era ship.
He maintained the sea routes and administered the port entry and did the Pilgrimage to Itsukushima by Sung-era ship.

sen.j: 1173年（承安 (日本)3年）には摂津国福原京の外港にあたる大輪田泊（現在の神戸港の一部）を拡張し、3月に正式に国交を開いて貿易振興策を行う。
sen.e: In 1173 he extended Owada no tomari (the part of present Kobe Port), which was outer port of Fukuhara-kyo district, Settsu Province, and established diplomatic relations with China to promote trade.
In 1173 he extended Owada no tomari (part of present Kobe Port), which was the outer port of Fukuhara-kyo district, Settsu Province, and established diplomatic relations with China to promote trade.

In 1173 he extended Owada no tomari (part of present Kobe Port), which was the outer port of Fukuhara-kyo (Capital of Fukuhara), Settsu Province, and established diplomatic relations with China to promote trade.

sen.j: 一方で、宋銭の大量流入による物価高騰や、唐朝滅亡以来の異国に対する社会不安なども起こっている。
sen.e: On the other hand, such measures caused price increase by the huge influx of Sung currency and social anxiety against foreign countries since the fall of Tang Dynasty.
On the other hand, such measures caused price increase by the huge influx of Sung currency and social anxiety against foreign countries since the fall of Tang Dynasty.
On the other hand, such measures caused price increase by the huge influx of Sung currency and social anxiety against foreign countries since the fall of Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 平氏政権が滅亡した後の鎌倉時代には日中間の正式な国交はなかった。
sen.e: There was no official diplomacy between Japan and China in Kamakura period after the fall of the Heike government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was no official diplomacy between Japan and China in Kamakura period after the fall of the Heike government.
There was no official diplomacy between Japan and China in the Kamakura period after the fall of the Heike government.

sen.j: だが、鎌倉幕府は民間貿易を認め、鎮西奉行が博多を統治して幕府からの御用商船を派遣するようになった。
sen.e: But, Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) allowed private trade and came to have Chinzei Bugyo (Defense Commissioner of the West) govern Hakata and send official merchant ships of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But, Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) allowed private trade and came to have Chinzei Bugyo (Defense Commissioner of the West) govern Hakata and send official merchant ships of the bakufu.

But, Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) allowed private trade and came to have Chinzei Bugyo (Defense Commissioner of the West) govern Hakata and send official merchant ships of the bakufu.

sen.j: 貿易は南宋末期まで行われた。
sen.e: The trade continued until the end of Southern Sung Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The trade continued until the end of Southern Sung Dynasty.
The trade continued until the end of Southern Sung Dynasty.

sen.j: 武士層が信仰した禅宗は北条氏得宗家も保護していたため、民間の渡来僧は貿易船に便乗して来日した。
sen.e: As the Tokuso Family of the Hojo clan also supported the Zen sect that samurai class worshipped, the private monks from China came to Japan on board the trade ships.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As the Tokuso Family of the Hojo clan also supported the Zen sect that samurai class worshiped, the private monks from China came to Japan on board the trade ships.
As the Tokuso Family of the Hojo clan also supported the Zen sect that samurai class worshiped, the private monks from China came to Japan on board the trade ships.

sen.j: モンゴル帝国による南宋攻撃が本格化してからも往来は継続している。
sen.e: The coming and going of people and goods continued after the attacking the Southern Sung by the Mongolian Empire went into full swing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The coming and going of people and goods continued after the attacking the Southern Sung by the Mongolian Empire went into full swing.
The coming and going of people and goods continued after the attacking the Southern Sung by the Mongolian Empire went into full swing.

sen.j: 南宋との経済交流は蒙古襲来（元寇）へも影響し、南宋の滅亡後も延長として日元貿易が行われている。
sen.e: Japan's economic exchange with Southern Sung affected the Mongolian invasion attempts against Japan, and the trade between Japan and Yuan Dynasty was done even after the fall of Southern Dynasty as the extension of the trade.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Japan's economic exchange with Southern Sung affected the Mongolian invasion attempts against Japan, and the trade between Japan and Yuan Dynasty was done even after the fall of Southern Dynasty as the extension of the trade.

Japan's economic exchange with Southern Sung affected the Mongolian invasion attempts against Japan, and the trade between Japan and Yuan Dynasty was done even after the fall of Southern Dynasty as the extension of the trade.

sen.j: だが、史料上にも乏しくなり、中国商人の日本居住が困難になっていたと考えられている。
sen.e: But the instances of the trade between the two countries became scarce in historical materials, and it is considered that Chinese merchants' residing in Japan had been already difficult by then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But the instances of the trade between the two countries became scarce in historical materials, and it is considered that Chinese merchants residing in Japan had been already difficult by then.
But the instances of the trade between the two countries became scarce in historical materials, and it is considered that Chinese merchants residing in Japan had been already difficult by then.

sen.j: 日本へは宋銭、陶磁器や絹織物、書籍や文具、香料や薬品、絵画などの美術品などが輸入された。
sen.e: The Sung currency, ceramics and silk goods, books and stationery, perfume materials and medicines, and fine arts including pictures were imported into Japan.
The Sung currency, ceramics and silk goods, books and stationery, perfume materials and medicines, and fine arts including pictures were imported into Japan.
The Sung currency, ceramics and silk goods, books and stationery, perfume materials and medicines, and fine arts including pictures were imported into Japan.

sen.j: 日本からは銅や硫黄などの鉱物や周防国など西国で産した木材、日本刀などの工芸品が輸出された。
sen.e: Minerals such as copper and sulfur, lumber produced in western pars of Japan including Suo Province and handicrafts including Japanese swords were exported from Japan.
Minerals such as copper and sulfur, lumber produced in western pars of Japan including Suo Province and handicrafts including Japanese swords were exported from Japan.
Minerals such as copper and sulfur, lumber produced in western pars of Japan including Suo Province and handicrafts including Japanese swords were exported from Japan.

sen.j: 日本に輸入された宋銭は、日本社会における貨幣利用の進展に役立ち、仏教経典の輸入は鎌倉仏教にも影響を与える。
sen.e: The Sung currency imported into Japan helped the currency use in Japan develop, and the imported Buddhist scriptures affected Kamakura Bukkyo (new Buddhist movements of the Kamakura period).
The Sung currency imported into Japan helped the development of currency use in Japan, and the imported Buddhist scriptures affected Kamakura Bukkyo (new Buddhist movements of the Kamakura period).
The Sung currency imported into Japan helped the development of currency use in Japan, and the imported Buddhist scriptures affected Kamakura Bukkyo (new Buddhist movements of the Kamakura period).
